quizzes.title: History Quiz: New York City and April
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, shops. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This restaurant, located in Central Park on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, was in operation from 1934 to 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tavern On the Green

questions.question: John Lennon was shot outside this building.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dakota

questions.question: What did Gideon Sundback patent on April 29, 1913?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zipper

questions.question: What U.S. president was born in Westmoreland County, VA on April 28, 1758?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Monroe

questions.question: TV shows like Dateline NBC, SNL, and the Today have been filmed in this famous New York City building.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC building

questions.question: Which U.S. president died on April 4, 1841 just one month after his inauguration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: Fifth Avenue in NYC is lined with prestigious shops and is consistently ranked among the most expensive shopping streets in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: New York City was the first capital of the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Does Brooklyn Bridge connect the boroughs of Staten Island and Brooklyn in New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which of these is a nickname of New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Where in NYC is Penn Station located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7th Ave and 34th st

questions.question: What Elvis Presley song hit the Billboard Charts at # 1 on April 21, 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heartbreak Hotel

questions.question: Who became the youngest golfer in history to win the Masters on the 13th of April, 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiger Woods

questions.question: What city was the Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr. assassinated in on April 4, 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memphis

questions.question: Where did the Titanic depart from en route to New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southhampton, England

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Alexandria and Landmark
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, egypt, abu. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Thanksgiving Song, performed and co-written by Adam Sandler, revolves around the repetition of what word?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: turkey

questions.question: Which of the following historical sites is located in Alexandria, Egypt?

options.text: The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

questions.question: What landmark near Islamic Cairo was home to Egypts rulers for 700 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Saladin Citadel

questions.question: A Sphinx features the body of a lion and a human head.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: St. Catherines Monastery was built by order of which Emperor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emperor Justinian

questions.question: The Monastery of Saint Anthony is located southeast of what Egyptian city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cairo

questions.question: If you are stationed in Germany, you will not be on a post, but most likely on which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kaserne

questions.question: What statement is true about the Colossi of Memnon?

options.text: The Colossi of Memnon are four massive stone statues.
The Colossi of Memnon are three massive stone statues.
The Colossi of Memnon are two massive stone statues.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colossi of Memnon are two massive stone statues.

questions.question: In the television special A Charlie Brown Thanksgiving, Charlie Brown and his friends sing a chorus of this popular Thanksgiving song.

options.text: Over the River and through the Woods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over the River and through the Woods

questions.question: A Thanksgiving Day celebration was held in December 1777 by the thirteen colonies to commemorate the defeat of the British at this location.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saratoga

questions.question: The Abu Simbel Temple was built during the reign of which pharaoh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramses II

questions.question: What did Howard Crater discover in 1922?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the tomb of Tutankhamun

questions.question: Name the American writer and editor who campaigned for the creation of the holiday known as Thanksgiving.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Josepha Hale

questions.question: What landmark is known in the Egyptian language as ipet resyt, or the southern sanctuary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luxor Temple

questions.question: Pompeys Pillar in Alexandria is a red-granite column erected in honour of Roman Emperor Diocletain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Republic and Ireland
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, pilgrims. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What musical instrument is depicted on the coat of arms of The Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harp

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the term Franksgiving?

options.text: It referred to a Thanksgiving holiday, held one week earlier than normal.
It was coined to describe the American Thanksgiving holiday from 1939–1941.
It is a portmanteau word from Franklin and Thanksgiving.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these popular musicians/bands is not Irish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Take That

questions.question: What term was used to refer to the period of fast economic growth in the Republic of Ireland between 1995 and 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In this 1992 biographical movie, starring Denzel Washington, the civil rights orator states: We didnt land on Plymouth Rock. Plymouth Rock landed on us.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malcolm X

questions.question: Unthanksgiving Day is an annual event commemorating the survival of Native American peoples following the settlement of Europeans in the Western Hemisphere. Where is the event held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alcatraz Island

questions.question: Champ is the name of a popular Irish dish. What does the popular Irish expression to be as thick as champ mean?

options.text: To be inflexible and unwilling to change
To be reticent and devoid of emotion

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To be stupid

questions.question: What punk rock band, formed in California, recorded the song Macys Day Parade on their album, Warning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Day

questions.question: Who is presented with a live domestic turkey at the annual ceremony known as National Thanksgiving Turkey Presentation?

options.text: the winners of the NFL Thanksgiving Classic
the best performer at the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the US President

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present on the national flag of the Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: Which of these words refers to a group of turkeys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: rafter

questions.question: Name the leader of the Plymouth Colony in Massachusetts who wrote Of Plymouth Plantation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Bradford

questions.question: What is the official language in the Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English and Irish

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of the Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dublin

questions.question: What was the name of the Native American who assisted the Pilgrims by teaching them techniques to increase food production?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squanto

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: April and United States
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cosmetics, deseret. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The State of Deseret was proposed in 1849 by settlers in Salt Lake City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Utah was part of United States when the Mormons first settled there.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What American hip hop artist, record producer and actor was born on April 1, 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Method Man

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of the Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Soldiers Song

questions.question: Cairo is the most populous metropolitan area in Africa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What color is traditionally worn on Saint Patricks Day, celebrated annually on March 17 as a public holiday in the Republic of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: On April 1, 1867 this country became a British crown colony.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Singapore

questions.question: On April 1, 1970, US President Richard Nixon signed an act into law, banning the advertisements of this product on television and radio in the United States starting on January 1, 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cigarettes

questions.question: What multinational corporation was founded on April 1, 1976 in Cupertino, California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple Computer, Inc.

questions.question: Irish writer James Joyce penned this popular novel, published in 1922 in Paris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses

questions.question: What important historical figure was born on April 1, 1815 in Schonhausen, Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Otto von Bismarck

questions.question: In what US state was American actress Debbie Reynolds born on April 1, 1932?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: What military operation was carried out on April 1, 1945 in Okinawa by United States troops?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Iceberg

questions.question: Which of these inventions was patented on April 1, 1826 by Samuel Morey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Internal combustion engine

questions.question: What legendary cosmetics tycoon passed away on April 1, 1965?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helena Rubinstein

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Cairo and Ice
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, egypt, structure. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official language in Cairo, Egypt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arabic

questions.question: The majority of ice in Earths biosphere is of this type.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice Ih

questions.question: In science “ice” refers to one of the crystalline phases of water. How many of them are known to exist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15

questions.question: What is the airport code for Cairo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CAI

questions.question: Which continent is Egypt in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Africa

questions.question: What year was the city of Cairo founded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 969 AD

questions.question: What is the official currency of Egypt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egyptian Pound

questions.question: What body of water is Cairo situated on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nile River

questions.question: As ice is a crystalline inorganic solid with an ordered structure, it is scientifically classified as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mineral

questions.question: What is the official name of Cairo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al-Qāhirah

questions.question: Why is ice slippery?

options.text: It is not in fact slippery, it makes the air between it and objects slippery.
Because the pressure of an object in contact with it causes a thin layer to melt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What does the term heat of fusion refer to in ice melting?

options.text: The temperature range at which the ice melts
The amount of energy consumed in breaking hydrogen bonds in the transition from ice to water
The amount of energy released when forming hydrogen bonds in the transition from water to ice
The temperature range at which ice forms

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The amount of energy consumed in breaking hydrogen bonds in the transition from ice to water

questions.question: In Cairo, the first two train cars of the subway are reserved for men only.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The eastern half of Cairo is dominated by the government buildings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Ice is the only known non-metallic substance to have this physical property.

options.text: It weighs more when it is heated.
It weighs more when it is cooled.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It expands when it freezes.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Town and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, summer, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the location of the Panagyurishte treasure, one of the best known surviving artifacts of Thracian culture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulgaria

questions.question: What legendary Hollywood actress starred in the 1959 movie Suddenly, Last Summer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katharine Hepburn

questions.question: The Preslav Treasure was found in Bulgaria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what country were the 2008 Summer Olympics held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Why did American Frederic Tudor became known as the “Ice King”?

options.text: He had the extraordinary ability to produce ice when he touched water.
He worked on developing better insulation products for the long distance shipment of ice.
He developed a technique for using ice as a source of heat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He worked on developing better insulation products for the long distance shipment of ice.

questions.question: Which of these characters appears in William Shakespeares comedy A Midsummer Nights Dream?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Midsummer holiday is associated with which event in the Christian calendar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birth of John the Baptist

questions.question: What atoms does the molecule of ice consist of?

options.text: Two oxygen atom and two hydrogen atoms
One oxygen atom and two nitrogen atoms
One oxygen atom and two hydrogen atoms
Two oxygen atom and one nitrogen atoms

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One oxygen atom and two hydrogen atoms

questions.question: In which U.S. state is there a town named Summersville?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missouri

questions.question: Which term collectively describes all parts of Earths surface where water is in frozen form?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cryosphere

questions.question: From which opera composed by George Gershwin is the famous aria Summertime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porgy and Bess

questions.question: What was discovered during demolition of an old building in the town of Środa, Poland on 8 June 1985?

options.text: rings and gold pendants, gold and silver coins
a medieval gold clasp decorated with precious stones

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these actors did not appear in the 1997 horror movie I Know What You Did Last Summer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brandy Norwood

questions.question: What is dry ice?

options.text: Ice formed from other substances different from water
Ice formed at temperatures under -78 degrees C
The solid form of carbon dioxide

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The solid form of carbon dioxide

questions.question: What popular actress portrayed Buffy Summers in the Buffy the Vampire Slayer TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Michelle Gellar
